questions.question: What is the main advantage of using smart contracts in digital transactions?

answers.a: They execute agreements automatically when conditions are met.
answers.b: They replace all legal systems worldwide.
answers.c: They guarantee physical delivery of products.
answers.d: They eliminate the need for encryption.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts execute automatically based on predefined rules, ensuring efficiency and trust.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Smart contracts cannot replace legal systems.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Smart contracts handle digital agreements, not physical delivery.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Encryption is still required to secure blockchain data.

questions.question: How do smart contracts enhance security in digital systems?

answers.a: By using cryptographic techniques to prevent tampering.
answers.b: By allowing anyone to change the terms at any time.
answers.c: By storing sensitive data in plain text.
answers.d: By sending email alerts to users.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts rely on cryptography and immutable blockchain records for security.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Smart contracts are immutable once deployed.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Data on the blockchain is encrypted, not stored in plain text.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Email alerts are unrelated to blockchain security.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes how smart contracts operate?

answers.a: They follow predefined conditions coded in software to execute actions automatically.
answers.b: They require manual approval for each transaction.
answers.c: They generate revenue without any rules.
answers.d: They work only with physical paperwork.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts execute automatically based on the rules defined in their code.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Manual approval is not needed unless coded as a condition.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Smart contracts do not create revenue automatically; they enforce rules.
explanations.d: Incorrect. They are purely digital and do not rely on physical paperwork.

questions.question: Why are smart contracts considered transparent?

answers.a: Because all transactions are recorded on a public or permissioned blockchain.
answers.b: Because they hide all user data from everyone.
answers.c: Because only the creator can see the contract details.
answers.d: Because they require manual verification of every step.

explanations.a: Correct! Transparency comes from the immutable blockchain ledger that records every action.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Smart contracts are not designed to hide data from all participants.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Transparency ensures multiple parties can verify the contract execution.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Execution is automated, not manually verified.

questions.question: What ensures that smart contracts are tamper-proof?

answers.c: Centralized control by a single organization.
answers.d: Storing contracts in local files on a computer.

explanations.a: Correct! Smart contracts benefit from the blockchainâ€™s immutable and cryptographically secured nature.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Manual audits help but do not guarantee tamper-proof execution.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Centralized control can make systems vulnerable to tampering.
explanations.d: Incorrect. Local files are not secure or immutable like blockchain.
